title: Strange ping spikes in all game modes.

replies.body:
What exactly do you mean by unplayable? I'm seeing some random lockups in my game that are making it extremely difficult to keep track of what is happening, it's like I'm getting slices of what's going on.

It *could* be ping spiking, but it feels more like my connection and/or the game itself - does this sound similar to your problem? It appears to be more common during teamfights or player interactions.

I'm with Telstra, always via cable.

That sounds exactly like my problem. Ill get the lock ups constantly, even while doing camps as a jungler as well as team fights or just simply walking around. I highly doubt its my internet because its fine when playing Counter-strike as that all I've been doing since this occurrence. As i said ive ran ping tests during a game and while my ingame ping was in the 80s and my test said i was at 28 ping, it doesn't add up.

Also ive asked some of my friend if they're having this problem and they've said no, but the people in their game were saying what you described.

Do you have something to track your downloads? I noticed that Windows Update was going in the background hogging all my resources at one point, keep an eye out for stuff like that.

It doesn't appear to be any particular game that has any trouble no, more like my connection to the server. Some people have no trouble and report me for being unable to hit skill shots when my connection freezes up, while at other times half the people in the game are complaining.

> [{quoted}](name=Oman2,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=IWzt5UJz,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-07-30T07:48:32.431+0000)
>
> Do you have something to track your downloads? I noticed that Windows Update was going in the background hogging all my resources at one point, keep an eye out for stuff like that.
> 
> It doesn't appear to be any particular game that has any trouble no, more like my connection to the server. Some people have no trouble and report me for being unable to hit skill shots when my connection freezes up, while at other times half the people in the game are complaining.

Would you look at that, Windows 10 was downloading in the "background"

When did you order Windows 10? Time to time I see "svchost.exe (netsvcs)" choking my entire bandwidth (it appears to give way to other programs on my PC, but not other devices on my network), apparently it's associated with Windows Update so it might be a similar problem.

How did you know it was Windows that was being downloaded?
Interesting - did the issues persist once the download finished?

> [{quoted}](name=Agent Mindstar,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=IWzt5UJz,comment-id=00020000000000010000,timestamp=2015-07-31T00:57:24.405+0000)
>
> Interesting - did the issues persist once the download finished?

Nope, All is fine.
Do you guys have your League framerate set to "uncapped" by any chance?  I've seen lockups like you describe on our competitive PCs when that is set...

Are you referring to fps capping? What are the best settings for this?

I don't think it's related, I had one fight where I was chasing their ADC and spamming everything I had at them, but it took forever for anything to actually fire - FPS shouldn't affect casting right?

So the issue I'm referring to can cause game lockups - but that also includes the client FPS being quite weird too (swinging between 200+FPS and <10FPS).  I wasn't clear from your description whether the game lockups mentioned were of that type.  That issue can happen on quite high-end PCs and cards, so its not necessarily a factor of poor PC performance.

But from what you are describing it sounds like the client performance itself is smooth (animations still display fine, screen not stuttering), but abilities & skillshots are not going off when you initially trigger them.

The best I can describe it is as if the game runs perfectly fine for some period, but then for no reason odd events occur.

The most common I would associate with lag, the game will "stop" as if the player did not change direction, but the animation will continue anyway. After a period, the game will "speed up" as if to compensate for time lost, playing the move/shoot etc. animations in the apparent order that they occur (often with team abuse inserted). It doesn't happen with every game, ironically I had a game with a very high ping before and it didn't happen a lot either.

It can also appear to "skip" certain parts of battles etc. instead, with everything sort of freezing, and it becomes very confusing when you're trying to heal someone who was already dead. Especially when the other guy abuses you because you didn't heal him.

Hey, I am having the same issue. It's been happening to me for a few days now. My ping is normally around 40 max but recently it has been spiking from 100-400. Speed tests are fine everything else seems fine, nothing is on in the background, it's just when I want to play a game of league it will randomly spike and do exactly what you described above. I was unsure what to do about it so I wanted to leave a comment to see if it gets solved.

This was my problem, Hiding at the bottom of my task manager/processes. I ended it and have had no problems in my recent 3 games. 
http://gyazo.com/a2d4da4253b095ab0d1d42a03adf8deb

I changed my update settings to tell me before downloading. i hope i dont need to keep ending this task everytime i log on.

Hey,

What ISP do you use?  Do you usually connect to your router via wifi or a cable?

Cheers
Mindstar

It happened to me last night whilst playing Malphite sup with a friend. I had just come out of a great game with a S+ and then there was these random ping spikes in the next game. Like wtf? The same thing was happening to our Yasuo as well. Usually,, my ping is quite stable with no lag whatsoever (even though I am with Vodafail) so I was quite surprised and annoyed at the same time.

Riot, please.
